meanings.definition: To disturb the smoothness or tranquility of
meanings.sent1: The strong wind ruffled the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent2: She quickly ruffled the papers on her desk while searching for the missing document.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy ruffled the feathers of the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected question ruffled her usual composure.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise outside ruffled her concentration like a sudden storm.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or uneven surface
meanings.sent1: The ruffled edges of the torn paper made it difficult to tape back together.
meanings.sent2: The ruffled fabric added a unique texture to the dress.
meanings.sent3: The ruffled edges of the old book gave it a vintage look.
meanings.sent4: The ruffled leaves of the plant felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The ruffled surface of the rock made it slippery to climb.

meanings.definition: A state of agitation or annoyance
meanings.sent1: After the argument, there was a noticeable ruffled atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent2: She tried to smooth over the ruffled feelings between her friends.
meanings.sent3: The ruffled mood in the office was palpable after the unexpected news.
meanings.sent4: The ruffled feathers of the bird showed its irritation.
meanings.sent5: The ruffled emotions in the room were like a brewing storm.
